title: Three American Pharoah-Style Stocks To Buy Now
text:
Disclosure: I’m long Fossil, Sanderson Farms, Santander Consumer USA Holdings and Facebook.
When American Pharoah streaked to victory in the Belmont Stakes last month, he became the first horse in 37 years to capture the Triple Crown — and it’s no coincidence that the drought was that long.
LOUISVILLE, KY: American Pharoah (Photo by Dylan Buell/Getty Images)
A number of challenges make it incredibly difficult to win horseracing’s biggest prize. One involves the diversity of the three races. While the Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes are run on slightly longer-than-average tracks, the Belmont is a mile-and-a-half long, a stamina-testing distance rarely used in American racing today. The composition of the track surfaces also varies quite a bit–the Belmont track is known as “Big Sandy” because of its softer texture, while the Preakness’ track long had a reputation for being hard and fast. When a horse can pass the test on all of these diverse tracks, it is truly a special performer.
The story is similar when it comes to stocks. I pick equities using my Guru Strategies, which are based on the published approaches of Warren Buffett , Benjamin Graham and other investing greats. Each of these models uses a unique set of rigorous financial and valuation tests. Getting approval from one of them is hard enough; if a stock can excel on two different strategies, that’s really impressive.
Then there are the rare occasions when a stock gets approval from three strategies–that’s when I get really excited. These “Guru Triple Crown” winners must excel when looked at from a myriad of different angles. Typically, they will have to meet dozens of criteria to ensure that they are producing solid growth, keeping debt to a minimum and trading at attractive valuations.
Very few stocks past three of my strategies at a given time–and they often aren’t companies you would expect. Ultra-popular stocks like Twitter Twitter or Facebook don’t make the grade–their sky-high valuations won’t hack it. Sometimes, Guru Triple Crown winners are unloved contrarian picks that are the subject of overhyped fears; often they are lesser-known firms that are flying under the radar.
